body:
So, here's my "problem," so to speak.

I need a keyboard that's better than my current one. This is it right here:



Yeah, it's not the best for gaming, or even typing in my opinion.
I find it somewhat uncomfortable to use because, while sleek and modern, it doesn't feel very good when I'm typing on it, and my hands feel a bit sore when using it for a while. The keys don't feel as satisfying as I'd like, and it's also getting really dirty (more so than I would like, lol.)

So, I'm wondering if anyone has good suggestions for a moderately-priced "gaming" keyboard. Here's some criteria:
  • Preferably wired, with a USB connection
  • Clean and appealing design - nothing too flashy, nothing too plain. Colors and backlighting would be cool, I guess.
  • I've never tried a mechanical keyboard (or at least I don't think I have) but I've heard they feel very satisfying to the touch and are recommended for gaming. Membrane keyboards are fine as I'm used to them, but a mechanical keyboard would be cool.
  • Volume buttons - absolute necessity, though I'm sure most keyboards have them. Media buttons are a nice addition as well.
  • Relatively light and easy to clean.
  • Price range: Up to $130 USD, though I REALLY want something under $100.
I don't need macro keys or a screen on my keyboard, or anything over the top like that. 

Thanks in advance! :D

title: Help - Gaming Keyboards?

replies.body:
OP.



To be honest, I really don't know any good ones off the top of my head, but I would definitely ask DoctaPop for a recommendation. :D

replies.body:
I heard someone called for me!

http://www.roccat.org/Products/Gaming-Keyboards/ROCCAT-Isku/

  • Rubber dome keys
  • Large wrist rest, makes it very comfortable.
  • Backlit cool, makes you look cool!
  • 5 different levels for brightness
  • 3 easy shift zones
  • 36 total macros (easy-to-reach)
  • 1000Hz polling rate, faster than most normal keyboards.
  • Profile switching (Comes with drivers)
One downside with this is that you don't get the mechanical keys because of the rubber dome keys, but it is not that much of a big deal if you ask me.
